entry.title: Multiplication leters with "aaa++" Text on Chat
entry.content:
I made an error by including the text "aaa+++" in a segment, which was then mistakenly multiplied several times. Gif from repro in attachements. Reproduced with Opera and Chrome Web browser.
To reprodce: 1. go to translate feature. (like in gif) 2. Switch language polish to english 3. type "biegac i podnosci teery, bo to sciaga blocka" 4. change manualy teery to "aaa 5 check result should be " run and lift aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaah block!"

entry.title: User is unable to scroll through list of saved tab groups
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem Situation: The user has a lot of saved tab groups, and just saved a new one.
The problem: But, the user isn't able to scroll through the list to find it. The list doesn't fit on the screen, and its display can't be changed.
# Problem Description Screencast of the problem: https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NTE1NDM1NzA1Mjk2NDg2NHw4ZGY5NWFjZS01Nw
My versions: Chrome version: Version 122.0.6261.49 (Official Build) (arm64) MacOS version: 14.3.1 (23D60)
# Additional Comments My recommended minimal fix: The list of saved tab groups should be scrollable.
My recommended bigger fix: Improve management of lots of tab groups. You can either offer the user a way to fully customize it, or you can pick default organization system that is good enough that users don't feel as much need to organizer. (Or both() - Good default idea: Organize saved tab groups into folders or sections within the drop-down menu of tab groups, organized by recency / use (e.g. tab groups saved in last 1 day, 1 week, 1 month, older). Make the most recent category automatically be unfolded so user can see actual tab groups as a top-level item (Without needing to navigate through folders in this most-common case). - Customization idea: Let the user customize (like via the bookmarks editing menu), just as they can make a subfolder structure for how bookmarks appear in the bookmarks strip.
A bit more commentary and rationale for my suggestions: What I proposed may seem overkill – isn't a simple drop-down with the names of saved tab groups good enough for most people? After all, you probably have data showing that most users don't make a super large number of tab groups, to the point where they are hard to manage. However, some users do tend to keep a ton of tabs open – you can see from my screencast I have 291. (My guess is ADHD people and PKM (Personal Knowledge Management) fans will be overrepresented in this group – and luckily for you, they both have chat groups where you can seek user feedback.) And it's precisely these users who (a) will benefit most from tab groups being awesome to help manage and triage, (b) are likely to create a ton of tab groups. In other words, this power-user-of-many-tabs is exactly the user group where you will create the most value and loyalty by developing out the feature (and also where you will learn the most from their expert usage, like how to build AI to triage tabs for others helpfully).
Other materials: Similar bug is at https://g-issues.chromium.org/issues/41494513 I realized this after writing my report and recommendations, so decided to file (as a private bug) even though it appears to be a dupe of that public one.
# Summary User is unable to scroll through list of saved tab groups
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: No

entry.title: $0 in console causes document instanceof Node === false
entry.content:
Chrome Version : 120.0.6099.272 (Official Build) (64-bit) OS : ChromeOS 120
What steps will reproduce the problem?
I found two ways to reproduce a similar problem, this simplest way is the following: 1. Open a page with an iframe that has no JS, e.g. https://buttery-intelligent-phone.glitch.me/ 2. Select the div within the iframe (by either clicking on it in the Elements pane or using the ctrl+shift+c tool). 3. In the console, select the "top" context and run "$0 instanceof Node" in the console (this will return true). 4. Now select the iframe context and again run "$0 instanceof Node" (this will return false).
And the second one, which is actually causing issues in our DevTools extension: 1. Open any page with an iframe. 2. Inject a content script only in the top frame (many extensions will do this by default - e.g. angular devtools, so you can reuse their context). 3. Select a div within an iframe. 4. In the console, select the extension context and run "$0.ownerDocument.defaultView". This will create a new extension context within the iframe. 5. In the console, select the new extension context (under the iframe) and run "$0 instanceof Node" or "document instanceof Node" (both return false). Now if the extension injects a content script into the iframe in the future, this context will always be broken (instanceof will not work correctly).
What is the expected result? $0 instanceof Node should return true when executing code in the context of the iframe that contains the selected element. document instanceof Node should always return true.
What happens instead? $0 instanceof Node returns true in whichever context the code is run first, and false in other contexts. Note that this doesn't just affect the code running in the console, but also any JS on the page. document instanceof Node returns false in the second example.
Possible workaround: Running some JS in each iframe before using $0. For extensions this means injecting a content script into every iframe.
You can help us a lot by creating a minimal, reproducible example (https://stackoverflow.com/help/minimal-reproducible-example), e.g. on glitch.com, and/or attaching a screenshot or recording of the issue!

entry.title: Talkback does not announce the correct progress bar percentage for a webpage when it is loading.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open Chrome 2. Type in a website 3. Observe that Talkback mentions 0 percent or the incorrect value.
# Problem Description TalkBack will incorrectly announce the loading percentage of the page. Screen readers users are unable to accurately tell if the webpage has fully loaded.
# Summary Talkback does not announce the correct progress bar percentage for a webpage when it is loading.
# Custom Questions #### Please select a label to classify your issue: Type-Bug - Software not working correctly
# Additional Data Category: Other \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Stuttering with VideoToolboxVideoDecoder and AV1 content on M3 devices.
entry.content:
There are multiple reports of stuttering with AV1 content that --disable-features=VideoToolboxVideoDecoder resolves. Forking this bug from issue 40075992.
We should turn down the experiment for 121 and see if we can get a fix in for M122/M123.

entry.title: Referrer-Policy header causes HTTP/3 connections to fail
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Launch a server that supports HTTP/1, HTTP/2, HTTP/3 on the same port 2. If the server returns a "Referrer-Policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin" header (though any value should work) then the URL_REQUEST fails with:
+HTTP_TRANSACTION_READ_HEADERS [dt=39] HTTP_TRANSACTION_RESTART_AFTER_ERROR --> net_error = -356 (ERR_QUIC_PROTOCOL_ERROR) -HTTP_TRANSACTION_READ_HEADERS
3. If the server response does not contain this header, the HTTP/3 connection is established just fine
# Problem Description Take a look at the attached net-export file, event #2733. Search for net_error = -356 (ERR_QUIC_PROTOCOL_ERROR).
# Summary Referrer-Policy header causes HTTP/3 connections to fail
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Not sure - I don't know
#### Does this work in other browsers? Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Memory leak when using :empty::before after node remove
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Create page with stylesheet with two selectors: .foo:empty:before {} .literallyAnySelector:empty+.literallyAnySelector {} 2. Insert some elements with .foo className 3. Edit innerHTML of .foo 4. Remove .foo element 5. Repeat several times. 5. Force GC and then capture memory dump. There is many detached nodes causing memory leak
# Problem Description We have :empty::before selector in our project stylesheet. Removing elements with this selector causing memory leaks.
# Summary Memory leak when using :empty::before after node remove
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>CSS
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Display does not turn off when idle
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Under Settings/Power, 2. Under "When Idle" for both "While charging" and "While on battery", 3. "Turn off display" is selected.
# Problem Description Screen display NEVER turns off. Tested multiple times, even over night. Chrome Version 120.0.6099.272 (Official Build) (64-bit) HP Chromebook, model 14a-na1093cl
# Summary Display does not turn off when idle
# Additional Data Category: Other \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: No

entry.title: Equal sign search failed
entry.content:
Chrome Version : Versão 121.0.6167.185 (Versão oficial) 64 bits OS : Windows 10 Pro - 22H2 - 19045.3930 - Windows Feature Experience Pack 1000.19053.1000.0
What steps will reproduce the problem?
When searching for the equal sign in Elements, some signs are ignored.
What is the expected result?
Count ALL equal signs
What happens instead?
Some equal signs are ignored and do not appear in search results.
You can help us a lot by creating a minimal, reproducible example (https://stackoverflow.com/help/minimal-reproducible-example), e.g. on glitch.com, and/or attaching a screenshot or recording of the issue!
Page example: https://loja.algartelecom.com.br/

entry.title: Page Up/Down does not work on the default Chrome homepage
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Have a keyboard connected to Pixel device, tap Fn + cursor up/down to get page up/down 2. 3.
# Problem Description Note that when trying to do Page Up/Down, nothing happens. The Chrome web page just stays/gets stuck at the same spot and never reaches the end of the page. Note that I am able to scroll by touching the screen, but not while using my connected keyboard.
# Additional Comments I see it with other sites e.g. BBC News but i don't know if it's all the same issue or not.
# Summary Page Up/Down does not work on the default Chrome homepage
# Custom Questions #### Example URL: Don't know
#### Does the problem occur on multiple sites? Yes - Please describe below
#### Is it a problem with a plugin? Not sure - I don't know
#### Does this work in other browsers? Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: Content \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Improve testing and documentation of embedded page nodes
entry.content:
page_node_impl_unittest.cc doesn't test any embedded page nodes, which means it will be easy to accidentally break their semantics. And I can't find anywhere that clearly defines things like "is the OnIsFocusedChanged notification delivered to embedded page nodes or just the top-level page node". This should be covered in the unit test.
It would also be helpful to add graphs to mock_graphs.h that include embedded page nodes, so that features can easily test those cases.

entry.title: Validate-Test-Flakiness: skip for android sync tests
entry.content:
In https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5300960, I am renaming some test from sync_integration_test and got rejected from the trybot.
Link to trybot: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/android-12-x64-rel/693999/overview
The failure seems to have nothing to do with my CL (it's about the compositor being called on the wrong thread). Sync tests seem extremely flaky on android in general, and even tests that I did not touch fail a lot on that bot.

entry.title: Add field trial config for the ModernTabStrip feature
entry.content: in order to enable ModernTabStrip, some tests need to be updated/fixed.

entry.title: DCHECK failure when printing tall monolithic block in inline in table
entry.content:
This seems to be why external/wpt/css/printing/table-overflow-quirks-frameset-crash-print.html is failing.
[759030:1:0219/171545.121309:FATAL:fragmentation_utils.cc(879)] Check failed: !physical_fragment.IsBox() || To<PhysicalBoxFragment>(physical_fragment).IsFirstForNode(). #7 0x7fd9dff1ff63 blink::BreakBeforeChild() #8 0x7fd9dff207ce blink::AttemptSoftBreak() #9 0x7fd9dfeabf11 blink::BlockLayoutAlgorithm::BreakBeforeChildIfNeeded()

entry.title: Drops cronjob without requiring cron
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. On a current Fedora installation install google-chrome-stable from the provided repository 2. Verify /etc/cron.daily/google-chrome is created, but no cron is installed 3. Cronjob will not be executed so no update of the repository and signing key will happen
# Problem Description If you look at the filelist of the package you will notice the cronjob dropped at /etc/cron.daily/google-chrome, but looking at the requirements you will not find a requirement on any cron implementation.
$ rpm -ql google-chrome-stable /etc/cron.daily/google-chrome ...
$ rpm -q --requires google-chrome-stable ...
Having a requirement on cron is only an intermediate solution I think as I see distributions moving forward on dropping cron in favour of systemd-timers, so dropping the current cronjob instead as a script in /usr/bin/ or somewhere under /opt/google/ and adding a systemd service unit of type oneshot started by a systemd timer unit would be the way to go on newer Linux distributions.
Just as a reference if whoever is reading my suggestion is not familiar with systemd-timers: https://opensource.com/article/20/7/systemd-timers
# Summary Drops cronjob without requiring cron
# Additional Data Category: Installation \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Debug check failed: IsWasmDispatchTable(table)
entry.content: deleted

entry.title: Incorrect HDR tone mapping when multiple display connected
entry.content:
If we connect two display, one enabled HDR, the other one disabled HDR. then Chrome will do wrong HDR tone-mapping on the display that disabled HDR.
This CL: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5111159 exposed the original issue. So I am going to submit a fix for this...

*If you want a head start or interested in contributing to chromium you can check out the “[Life of a Chromium Developer](https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/chromium-dev/c/ybLzH8-FoTc/m/YhTe2g9L7CUJ)”, “[contributing](https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/contributing.md)”, or “[getting involved](https://www.chromium.org/getting-involved)” for information about getting the code and general flow of making a change to the code base.*
*If you have general questions not about a project you should instead email the mailing list chromium-gsoc@chromium.org and the admins can assist you.*
*--------------- Template 2 ------------------*
**Request For Project Proposal Review**
Please use our [template for a proposal](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1IOj4hSdPl8h1-8zYK_Gt3OxA0R44SLbmr-ZH3f9yDXM/edit?usp=sharing)
But we also encourage you to read GSoC's [writing a proposal](https://google.github.io/gsocguides/student/writing-a-proposal) and [example proposal](https://google.github.io/gsocguides/student/proposal-example-1). We suggest you reach out early engage with the starter bug of your project, and submit a proposal soon after you have a handle on the problem.
* Link to Google doc that contains your proposal: * Desired Project length (if different from project slide's suggestions): * Desired Project size (if different from project slide's suggestions): *Small/Medium/Large* * Any additional comments:

entry.title: Correctly use key kBrowserStatesLastActive (at the moment it's never used)
Don't send empty priority header
entry.content: Chrome currently sends an empty value for the priority header when all values are the default. The header should be omitted in that case per RFC 8941 https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc8941.html#section-3.2-15

entry.title: Emoji presentation scanner maintains two UTF16RagelIterators leading to duplicate calls per codepoint
entry.content:
The Ragel generated emoji presentation scanner is mapped to working on top of `UTF16RagelIterator`. Increment, decrement and assign operations in the Ragel scanner (which usually access `chars` directly) are mapped to overloaded operator implementations. A change of cursor position leads to updating the internally stored emoji presentation category.
Because the scanner internally performs assignments, which may include copy assignments, in some situations two `UTF16RagelIterator` instances are active at the same time. Due to the order in which the scanner increments them, it looks like we perform multiple emoji category lookup per cursor position in the input text run.

entry.title: Not able to search xpath located elements from inspector console (DevTools - Elements tab)
entry.content:
Chrome Version : 121.0.6167.185 (Oficjalna wersja) (64-bitowa) (cohort: Stable) OS : Wersja Windows 11 Enterprise, 23H2, 22631.3155, Windows Feature Experience Pack 1000.22684.1000.0
What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to prepared demo Service Now instance -> https://dev203607.service-now.com
2. Login as demo user user_name: chrome.dev user_password: Demo_password1 *if needed i may reset pwd - just let me know
3. After login with mentioned user creds go to demo created incident -> https://dev203607.service-now.com/now/nav/ui/classic/params/target/incident.do%3Fsys_id%3Da83820b58f723300e7e16c7827bdeed2%26sysparm_view%3Dess%26sysparm_record_target%3Dincident%26sysparm_record_row%3D1%26sysparm_record_rows%3D1%26sysparm_record_list%3Dcaller_id%253Djavascript%253Ags.getUserID%2528%2529%255Eactive%253Dtrue%255Euniversal_requestISEMPTY%255EORDERBYDESCnumber
Open page inspector (DevTools Elements) and try to find 2 locators with ctrl+f option. 1st. el. is inside gsft_main iframe, 2nd. el is outside gsft_main frame.
eg. xpath locators for tests: 1) inside gsft_main iframe (expected) -> //*[@id="sys_readonly.incident.number"] 2) outside gsft_main iframe (unexpected) - > //div[@id="1b682fe1c3133010cbd77096e940dd18"]
What is the expected result? Inside gsft_main frame we're able to search for xpath locators as expected. Expected results is that we will be able to find mentioned elements inside and outside gsft_main iframe from DevTools Elements tab
What happens instead? Expected elements from outside gsft_main iframe are not visible in (DevTools Elements not show any element which is in page source). Outside gsft_main frame we're not able to find elements. (see screenshots below) eg. xpath locator to "Favourites" button - > //div[@id="1b682fe1c3133010cbd77096e940dd18"]
If any more details needed please let me know, i can prep live hands on demo to show an issue.

entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open Discover view in iOS Chrome
# Problem Description Sorry I didn't provide the Chrome version. I'm filing this on behalf of my friend (hope I can pass this to the friend and he can add more info). When he opened up the Discover view in iOS Chrome, it showed multiple parcel tracking (Fedex specifically) popups in the view. He has no idea what those parcels are. One of the parcels even had a tracking number looking like a test data (no.: 123456789012).

entry.title: Reconsider whether IdentityManager completely disabling scope checking is the right approach
entry.content:
As part of crbug.com/40066882, https://crrev.com/c/4786107 introduced a parameter to bypass scope access validation on iOS, with TODOs to do the same on other platforms.
During a code review, bsazonov@ pointed out that this may not be the desired end state.
This bug is about reconsidering this decision and possibly coming up with a better replacement to fully disabling scope access validation.
